alert.note: Alert for Rockland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 7:10AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast New Jersey and southeast New York, including the following counties, in northeast New Jersey, Bergen. In southeast New York, Rockland. * WHEN...Until 1015 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 709 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Up to an inch of rain has already fallen in some locations. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New City, Monsey, Nanuet, Ramsey, Suffern, Sloatsburg, Pearl River, Spring Valley, Hillsdale, Valley Cottage, Park Ridge, Airmont, Upper Saddle River, Chestnut Ridge, Montvale, Hillcrest, New Square, Viola, Allendale and Woodcliff Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
